title: WCAS GREEK 201-3-1 Introduction to Greek Literature

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course is the third and final element of the second-year Greek series. In this course we will read significant sections of Homer's Iliad in the original language. Students will develop an ability to read the Homeric dialect and gain an understanding of the conventions of ancient epic poetry. As we explore the earliest European literary work we will also survey several important scholarly issues regarding the nature and history of the poem, including the nature of its composition and its place in ancient Greek society.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Successful completion of Greek 201-2-20, or permission of instructor.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
To enhance fluency in reading ancient Greek.

To solidify command of vocabulary and grammatical principles.

To develop an ability to read the Homeric dialect of Greek

To develop an appreciation for the scholarly issues surrounding the Homeric poems

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value:
Class participationDiscussionLecture: Three 50-minute lectures weekly
ReadingsTeaching method: in-class translation of prepared passages, comments and discussion, brief secondary readings.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: AttendanceExam, finalExam, mid-termHomeworkQuizzesReadingsEvaluation method: attendance and participation, weekly quizzes, a midterm exam and a final exam.
